meanings.definition: A cause of fear or alarm; a ghost or phantom.
meanings.sent1: The old abandoned house was said to be haunted by bogles.
meanings.sent2: The children whispered stories of bogles lurking in the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The idea of bogles hiding in the closet made the little girl giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The foggy night seemed to shroud the town in a cloak of bogles.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the bogle was passed down through generations, growing more terrifying with each telling.

meanings.sent1: The sudden loud noise bogles the cat, making it jump.
meanings.sent2: Unexpectedly seeing a spider can bogles some people.
meanings.sent3: The prankster loved to bogle his friends by jumping out from behind doors.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie was so scary that it bogles the audience into silence.
meanings.sent5: The eerie sound of footsteps in the empty hallway bogles the security guard on duty.

meanings.sent1: The little bogle kept playing pranks on his siblings.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was disrupted by the antics of the class bogle.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the bogle caused quite a commotion in the house.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous bogle was always up to some new scheme.
meanings.sent5: The bogle's constant teasing finally wore down his friends' patience.
